text: one of the things that we've been able
to do with AWS is turn our Enterprise
Integration functions into a very
developer friendly and very Innovative
platform for change that's enabled us to
introduce change in unexpected parts of
the business from our e-commerce uh
Partners all the way to the back end for
our data warehouse my name is Jeff Gelb
I am the head of foundational
engineering for Scholastic Incorporated
Scholastic is the world's largest
publisher and distributor of children's
books we're also a leading provider of
educational materials for students and
for teachers in K through 8 we publish
in 165 countries we publish in 45
languages and our core mission is to
improve education for children through
literacy Scholastic's iconic book is
Clifford the Big Red Dog we're also the
Publishers of the Magic School Bus The
Hunger Games Harry Potter and Captain
Underpants when we got started we had uh
one major data center for all of our
customer facing web hosting operations
and we had another one that was aligned
with our Warehouse Systems we are on
track to closed down the web hosting and
e-commerce data center by the end of
2016 AWS has given us straight line cost
savings the cost of US providing the
same set of services that we were doing
before we found is about 60% of what we
were doing before we got started with
AWS and the time it takes to deploy
services for us has dropped from
sometimes weeks down to minutes one of
the most tangible examples of our
ability to start and stop that AWS has
has helped us with is with our
integration platform when we got started
with that we were running our own
analytics and log aggregation platform
we started to evaluate aws's elastic
search as a service when it was in beta
and as soon as AWS announced that it was
in general release we were immediately
able to stop the infrastructure that we
were running ourselves and take
advantage of the levels of service and
the ease of use that aws's elastic
service brought to us it allowed us to
put things into service faster to expand
and contract in line with our seasons
and our customer needs um and it's
enabled our business partners within
Scholastic to innovate in a way that
they never were able to do before in
part because the the cost and time to
putting into Services drastically lower
than it was before AWS has made my job
easier in part because it's made my job
possible I started at Scholastic to help
us bootstrap and speed up our Cloud
migrations and I knew with AWS that that
was going to be successful and I would
never have to worry about our cloud
provider being the pic there's really no
reason to not Forge ahead with AWS these
days the level of service the breadth of
service and the ability of AWS to
deliver has turned an IT function that
used to be very opaque and slow moving
into something that frequently is
leading the business and has really
helped us as technologist to show that
we are business partners rather than
just a pure operations
[Music]
function
